overall.comments: Good job on your booklet. Remember elaboration is key to convey your thoughts properly!

challenges.comments: Good job on your challenges. Try and use more categories for more points.

packet.text: Because the new technology provided by the SSI has never been used, and so much money has been invested into it, there may be a challenge because the new system hasn't been implemented in the community. As a result the effort and funding used in this sytem may be wasted on a faulty system

Since the technology being used is so new and modern, there may be a challenge with older generations who aren't up to date with technology having trouble understanding the new system. As a result, they may not get the help that they need

Since the Government of Georgetown is [not sure] funding the safe street Initiative and providing them will top of the line technology, then there may be budget cuts from other government funded departments and institutions, such as public schooling.

Since citizens cearly oppose the Safe Street Initiative, especially those involved with the Justice Reform Network Headquarters, (JRNH) then the SSI may not garner enough public support, leading to it being cancelled before it is implimented, which could lead to economic disparity due to the supplies of the program being purchased prior.

In 2039, becuase of the serveillance technology available, there may be a problem with the use of the technology which would be purchased via the SSI. Due to tchnology like the Interactive Surveillance and the Implanted lens, citizens could lose their sense of privacy. This could lead to phsyicological issues and greater division between law enforcement and the people. This could become a problem if the "omnipitent" aspect of the Interactive Surveilance, listening and hearing everything, is misused to spy or invade upon people's privacy.

In 2039, in Georgetown, becuase the technology that would b purchased via SSI is very reliant on technology there may be an issue with hackers using this technology to feed the police false information. This is a problem becuase it undermines the usefullness of SSI making it obsolete, and even a tool against the police. This could become a problem if the new technology is taken advantage of.

The SSI criminal justice system puts a lot of trust and Power into the hands of the citizens. Because citizens typically have no [not sure] of training when it comes to criminal justice, the citizens may be unreliable when it comes to reporting and assisting in the crimination of criminals. This may put the public's safety at risk becuase untrustworthy citizens may be assigned to the taks of dealing with criminals that are a threat to the community.

Because the new SSI system heavily relies on multiple forms of technology for it's function, the system may become extreamly expensive to impliment. Lower class citizens may not be able to afford this technolgy while more healthy citizens will. This may lead to a social divide between those who are able to afford the technology and those who aren't (the "haves" and "havenots")

Because Georgetown's new Safe Street Initiative (SSI) program puts the majority of power regarding criminal justice systems into the hands of citizens, how might we increase citizen participation in the SSI system so that the safety of the community is not compromised due to the criminal justice in 2039?

UP.comments: Good job on correctly formatting your UP but remember to have a KVP and purpose that clearly relate more to each other and to the big issue of the fuzzy

cp.text: Becuase Georgetown's new Safe Street Initiative (SSI) program puts the majority of power regarding criminal justice systems into the hands of citizens

stem-and-kvp.kvp-text: increase citizen participation in the SSI system

purpose.text: so that the safety of the community is not compromised due to the criminal justice in 2039

solutions.comments: Good job on doing your solutions. Remember to elaborate so you can fully explain how it will lead to your purpose.

packet.text: The Georgetown Justice Society (GJS) will develop a system of IR (infrared) cameras that scane crime scenes to detect any people who did not report the crime, and those who did. Due to a societal norm called the bystander effect, people not reporting crimes witnessed by large groups of peole is a common problem. Those found not reporting the crime will be charged with a small fine or community service.

The Georgetwon Police Department (GPD) will work with Microsoft to develop the Panic! Button (P!B) for the Safe Street Initiative. This will be a small device with an AMOLED screen with a large red button that when pressed will report a crime. This device will be sent to call citizens, and it's simplicity will allow it to be used more often.

The government will start a grass roots movement/campaign that will encourage participation in the justice system. The use of propaganda will make participation in the system part of everyday life and will encourage the consitent use of the program. This will cause more participation which will in return, cause the citizens to be softer

The government will offer tax incentives to people who use the systems. The citizens will be more likely to participate if they are rewarded with the finacial reward. This will make the community safer by encouraging citizens to be more torough when it comes to their role in the Criminal justice system.

In 2039, the Georgetown Police department will instate policies that make SSI instructional classs for the public. They will do this to increase citizen/public participation and useage of the SSI systems. The Police department will do this with funding and resources from SSI funding.

In 2039, the Georgetown Police will modify the SSI system used to report crimes so that it will provide an incentive. The incentive will involve the number of accurate reports filed by a citizen. For filing many accurate reports and citizen could have minor misdeminors waived, and/or taken of their record. The Georgetown Police will do this to increase the participation of citizens in the SSI program. They will do this by accessing personal criminal records, and creating a new category for waivered minor misdeminors

In 2039, the Georgetown Police will collaborate with gaming companies to create software that allows people to report crimes to SSI, but the process will be like a game. The Police will do this to encourage more community participation in SSI programs especially will younger citizens. They will accomplish this by incorporating SSI software into the framework of a game.

In 2039, the SSI program will establish an online record system that keeps track of how many crimes you have accuratly reported with SSI. Using this information, citizens would be rewarded with a variety of monetary compensation and other incentives. SSI will do this to increase the the participation in their program. SSI will do this by creating this record system in joint with their other systems

criteria.comments: Good job on doing your criteria and grid correctly

packet.text: Which solution allow citizens to have the most power in the criminal justice system?
Which solution will increase participation of the SSI system the greatest?
Which soltuion will compromise the safety of the Georgetown community the least?
Because the SSI system will be used to incriminate criminals, Which solution will be most effective in probably convicting criminals?
Because Georgetown's current criminal justice is failing, which solution will allow the new SSI system to be implimented in the most amount of time

grid.comments: Good job on doing your criteria and grid correctly

packet.text:
The SSI will create a record system that allows you to see how many crimes you've reported and also let you report crimes. You will have your own profile, and you can get rewards for reporting crimes. When you link your personal technology to the system, the rewards will go straight to your account. THe more crimes you report, the safer the community will be. To prove that you have reported a crime, you can hook your personal technology to the system. An obstacle with this system would be peole trying to lie about the number of crimes they've reported. As mentioned earlier though, the evidence will come from personal technology being hooked up to the record system.
 There will be some assistance and resistance for this solution. THe forms of assistance would be from citizens who have experienced a crime. They would help by funding the program. Another form of assistance would be peole who are against crime. They will help the SSI in Georgetown create and fund the record system. One form of resistance would be citizens who don't want to cooperate with the police. To get past this form of resistance, we can convince them that this system will help keep crime rates at bay and keep their community safe. This saves the Underlying Problem becuase if more crimes are reported using the record system, less criminal activity would take place. Also citizens will most likely want to report crimes for the rewards.
 Besides solving the underlying problem, this solution can save other problems. If the SSI adds more uses to this system, one of them could be a place to store medical records. This would make it easier for people working in the medical field to view the records of their patients, because they just need to use the system. Also, becuase everyone has a profile, the police could view this and use it as a way to identify suspects of a crime

AP.comments: Good job on your action plan but elaborate to improve development.
